article.Heading: Budget 2016: Gamesa India boss highlights what renewable energy sector needs
article.Summary: Gamesa India Chairman Ramesh Kymal emphasized on the need for equality between energy sectors, to hit that target announced.
article.Body:
India's renewable energy sector has its work cut out for it. While the government has laid out an ambitious target of 175 giga-watts of renewable energy projects by the year 2022, the industry feels that this can be achieved only if incentives are provided to level the playing field between solar, wind and conventional energy.

CNBC-TV18's Jude Sannith caught up with Gamesa India Chairman Ramesh Kymal, to know exactly what is needed on ground. Kyaml emphasized on the need for equality between energy sectors inorder to hit the target announced.

Further, he believes infrastructure and Reseach and Development (R&D) can be big game-changers for the progress of these projects.
